content.description: From DB's 2016 guide: "Start in the back of the alcove with the wooden bench and move left and up to chains. Bolted on lead." Clip your first two bolts (one on very low-angle, the other another 10 feet up) then start looking left. Do not clip the next two bolts higher up the alcove -- these seem to go nowhere at all! 7 or 8 more bolts along some nice classic Castle granite up to some solid 5.9 slab.
content.location: Head up into the alcove from the wooden "benches." Watch rope drag on sharp granite.

content.description:
From DB's 2016 guide: "Start in the back of the alcove and move right, finishing with a short crack. Chain anchor."

My climbing partner and I clipped four bolts going up to the back of the alcove then could find no more going off to climber's right. I think here it must be all gear to the top following a good-looking large hand crack, though we didn't get to do that since we didn't bring gear.
content.protection: 4 bolts (guide says 10) to the back of the alcove.
content.location: Same start as The Patriot and Cleft Palace. Start by the wooden "benches."

content.description: Climb the face just right of Gullet, ending at a lower anchor. Clip two bolts on the low-angle part then head to your right. Bolts follow a jagged arete then up to slab.
content.protection: At least 6 bolts. Page contributor didn't climb this route!
content.location: Same approach as The Patriot and Gullet. Turn right where Patriot goes left. Benches for belay!

content.description: Mixed. Mostly bolts with 2 gear placements in largish cracks. This is a well bolted, very fun line. The grade from the guidebook seems about right.
content.location: Follow signs for lower comp wall and three spires. There are some stairs at the base of the formation. It looks just like an elf's hat. Walk left a bit and there is a small staging area. You have to scramble up a boulder to reach the start.
